intro: Melampyrum barbatum var. carstiense, commonly known as the Carstens' yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. Its small, oval-shaped leaves are arranged opposite along the stem, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
